Note: I am currently seeking out research roles within academia or industry. If my profile fits your requirements, please feel free to reach out to me.

Adriano D'Alessandro

PhD Candidate (Computer Science)

Email GitHub Bluesky Google Scholar

I’m a computer vision researcher and PhD candidate living in Vancouver. My work focuses on object counting with limited data, and lately, I’ve been diving into using synthetic data from latent diffusion models to train counting models. I’m also into things like plant agriculture and biodiversity—basically, anywhere counting and nature intersect in interesting ways.

Education

PhD Computer Science | Simon Fraser University
Present
BSc. Computer Science | University of Guelph
2017
BSc. Chemistry | University of Guelph
2012

Publications & Book Chapters

Just Say the Word: Annotation-Free Fine-Grained Object Counting | arxiv

Authors: Adriano D'Alessandro, Ali Mahdavi-Amiri, Ghassan Hamarneh

Moving beyond inference-time conditioning for fine-grained object counting by prompt tuning using synthetic data.

2025
AFreeCA: Annotation-Free Counting for All | ECCV

Authors: Adriano D'Alessandro, Ali Mahdavi-Amiri, Ghassan Hamarneh

Utilizing latent diffusion models for annotation-free object counting across diverse categories.

2024
Learning-to-Count by Learning-to-Rank | CVR

Authors: Adriano D'Alessandro, Ali Mahdavi-Amiri, Ghassan Hamarneh

Reducing the annotation burden for object counting by leveraging ranking supervision.

2023
The human impact of data bias and the digital agricultural revolution | Handbook on the human impact of agriculture, Edward Elgar Publishing

Authors: Kelly Bronson, Sarah Rotz, Adriano D'Alessandro

A analysis of big datasets and the ‘intelligent’ machines which use them in decision support systems for farmers.

2021
Name2vec: Personal names embeddings | CCAI

Authors: Jeremy Foxcroft, Adriano D'Alessandro, Luiza Antonie

Creating name-embeddings for record linkage and document retrieval using Doc2Vec

2019

Undergraduate Research Assistant | Luiza Antonie Research Lab, University of Guelph
